intro: Athamanta ajowan, commonly known as black cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant produces small, dark seeds that are rich in essential oils, giving it a strong, pungent aroma. These seeds are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications due to their purported health benefits. Its botanical features include finely divided, feathery leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters.
